algorithm_technique: Mathematical observation: each match eliminates one team, so n-1 matches are needed for n teams.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the total matches played in a tournament until one winner remains.
problem_summary_technical: Each match eliminates one team. To get from n teams to 1 winner, n-1 teams must be eliminated, requiring n-1 matches.
key_insights: Regardless of whether the number of teams is even or odd, each match results in exactly one team being eliminated.
To reduce 'n' teams to a single winner, 'n-1' teams must be eliminated.
Therefore, exactly 'n-1' matches must be played in total.
